column37: 2-5 over hurdles, the latter win gained on handicap debut at Sandown (2m, good to soft) in March; may still have more to offer but some of the others here have stronger form.

column36: Runner-up at Perth (3m, good) last time and he's respected off unchanged mark

column4: Hitz Horizons Handicap Chase (Go North Red Rum Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

column37: £3,000 4yo; by Getaway; dam 1m3f Flat (RPR 88) and 2m3f hurdle winner; yard has the odd bumper winner; worth monitoring in the market.

column36: 4th of seven in Haydock Group 3 (1m2f, good) nine weeks ago makes him a leading contender
column37: Held up; Meydan improvement (mostly on on fast ground) was backed up when third in 1m1f Group 3 here in April but, after 116 days off, it's his fourth of seven in Haydock Group 3 (1m2f, good) nine weeks ago on latest start which makes him a leading contender on form.

column4: Too Darn Hot Darley Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Fast ground is no problem for FIRST CONQUEST and he registered career-best form last time out. Damysus has to be feared most.

column4: Too Darn Hot Darley Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Fast ground is no problem for FIRST CONQUEST and he registered career-best form last time out. Damysus has to be feared most.

column36: Below form at Royal Ascot after a year off; lightly raced and has a chance if back on song

column4: Too Darn Hot Darley Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Fast ground is no problem for FIRST CONQUEST and he registered career-best form last time out. Damysus has to be feared most.

column27: Newsells Park Stud & Merry Fox Stud
column36: Back on track for 1m2f French Listed win and he surely retains potential
column37: Third in the Sandown Classic Trial in April and second in Group 2 Dante at York (good to firm) in May; ran poorly in the Derby but bounced right back when readily landing a 1m2f Listed race at Deauville in August; needs another step forward to take this and the drop back in trip might not be ideal, but he surely retains potential.

column19: Fast ground is no problem for FIRST CONQUEST and he registered career-best form last time out. Damysus has to be feared most.

column32: Qatar BS, China Horse Club & D Howden
column36: Fourth in York Group 3 latest; needs to maintain progressive profile but that is possible
column37: Won a maiden and two handicaps from his five starts, the latest win at Glorious Goodwood (1m1f); good fourth of eight when upped to Group 3 at York (1m1f, good to firm) seven weeks ago; needs to maintain his progressive profile but that is possible.

column4: Too Darn Hot Darley Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Fast ground is no problem for FIRST CONQUEST and he registered career-best form last time out. Damysus has to be feared most.

column36: Best form on his last two starts but this race requires a chunk of improvement
column37: Won a three-runner maiden at Doncaster in May on second start; well beaten in the Group 2 Dante at York (good to firm) in May, with better form for minor honours at 1m2f (on softer than good) in his two starts since but this race requires a chunk of improvement.

column4: Night Of Thunder Zetland Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Endorsement and Look To The Stars are considered but PIERRE BONNARD makes more appeal. The chief threat may be Spyce.

column36: Won novice events from the front when odds-on at Kempton (1m, AW) on last two starts
column37: Dam half-sister to St Leger winner Eldar Eldarov; second at Doncaster (7f, good) in July and won novice events from the front when odds-on at Kempton (1m, AW) on both starts since, by nearly 10l on first occasion and a neck on latest; should stay 1m2f and not dismissed.

column4: Night Of Thunder Zetland Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Endorsement and Look To The Stars are considered but PIERRE BONNARD makes more appeal. The chief threat may be Spyce.
column20: 9/4 Endorsement, 3/1 Look To The Stars,  Pierre Bonnard, 7/1 Allegresse, 10/1 Spyce, 16/1 Del Maro, 18/1 Mr Colonel, 20/1 Loz Vegas
column36: Hood returns; plenty of ability and bred to stay but yet to get his act together
column37: Two seconds and a third from his three starts, short-priced favourite in them all; best form when beaten a head by a last-ditch rally in maiden here (1m, good) last time; twice slowly away, including that day when he also raced freely; wore a hood for first two races and it's back today; he has plenty of ability and is bred to stay but yet to get his act together.

column4: Night Of Thunder Zetland Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Endorsement and Look To The Stars are considered but PIERRE BONNARD makes more appeal. The chief threat may be Spyce.
column20: 9/4 Endorsement, 3/1 Look To The Stars,  Pierre Bonnard, 7/1 Allegresse, 10/1 Spyce, 16/1 Del Maro, 18/1 Mr Colonel, 20/1 Loz Vegas
column36: Carries his head bit high but asserted late on last time (1m1f) and this trip should suit
column37: Very well related; plenty of promise at Killarney on debut and went one better when evens for a maiden at Tipperary (1m1f, good to yielding) six weeks ago; carries his head a bit high but asserted late on last time and this trip should suit; top yard also runs Pierre Bonnard.

column4: Night Of Thunder Zetland Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Endorsement and Look To The Stars are considered but PIERRE BONNARD makes more appeal. The chief threat may be Spyce.
column20: 9/4 Endorsement, 3/1 Look To The Stars,  Pierre Bonnard, 7/1 Allegresse, 10/1 Spyce, 16/1 Del Maro, 18/1 Mr Colonel, 20/1 Loz Vegas
column36: Won his last two; tricky to settle and carries head high but he's been galloping on at 1m
column37: Two seconds followed by a gelding operation and two wins; latest was in a traditionally strong conditions stakes at Newbury (1m, good to soft) three weeks ago, always front rank; unraced on firmer than good; tricky to settle and carries his head high but he's been galloping on at 1m and looks his stable first string on jockey bookings.

column4: Night Of Thunder Zetland Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Endorsement and Look To The Stars are considered but PIERRE BONNARD makes more appeal. The chief threat may be Spyce.
column20: 9/4 Endorsement, 3/1 Look To The Stars,  Pierre Bonnard, 7/1 Allegresse, 10/1 Spyce, 16/1 Del Maro, 18/1 Mr Colonel, 20/1 Loz Vegas
column36: Unable to get to grips with Look To The Stars at Newbury but looked a candidate for 1m2f
column37: Took a huge step forward in a four-runner maiden at Sandown (1m, good) on second start and, having been hampered, he was awarded the race; 25-1 when unable to get to grips with Look To The Stars at Newbury (1m, good to soft) three weeks ago, with the late lack of room probably not costing him much but he looked a candidate for 1m2f.

column4: Night Of Thunder Zetland Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Endorsement and Look To The Stars are considered but PIERRE BONNARD makes more appeal. The chief threat may be Spyce.
column20: 9/4 Endorsement, 3/1 Look To The Stars,  Pierre Bonnard, 7/1 Allegresse, 10/1 Spyce, 16/1 Del Maro, 18/1 Mr Colonel, 20/1 Loz Vegas
column36: Promising for 1m2f but beaten a neck both starts and he is bottom of this pack on ratings
column37: Beaten a neck in maiden at Hamilton (1m, good to firm) and novice at Ayr (1m, good to soft); did his best work late on last time (wears cheekpieces today) and that was promising for 1m2f but he is bottom of this pack on ratings.

column4: Night Of Thunder Zetland Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Endorsement and Look To The Stars are considered but PIERRE BONNARD makes more appeal. The chief threat may be Spyce.
column20: 9/4 Endorsement, 3/1 Look To The Stars,  Pierre Bonnard, 7/1 Allegresse, 10/1 Spyce, 16/1 Del Maro, 18/1 Mr Colonel, 20/1 Loz Vegas
column36: Won a maiden at Dundalk (1m, AW) on second start and plenty to like about that performance
column37: Beaten 8l on debut at Leopardstown (1m, yielding to soft) in July but much better to justify 6-5 favouritism in a 12-runner maiden at Dundalk (1m, AW) in August and there was plenty to like about that performance; half-sister to 3yo Crepe Suzette who was third in last month's 14.5f Park Hill; Group 1 Futurity entry, admittedly one of 12 from his yard but no shock if he is a big player in this.

column4: Night Of Thunder Zetland Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Endorsement and Look To The Stars are considered but PIERRE BONNARD makes more appeal. The chief threat may be Spyce.
column20: 9/4 Endorsement, 3/1 Look To The Stars,  Pierre Bonnard, 7/1 Allegresse, 10/1 Spyce, 16/1 Del Maro, 18/1 Mr Colonel, 20/1 Loz Vegas
column36: Second in the Convivial Maiden at York (7f) and got on top by a neck at Yarmouth (1m)
column37: 280,000gns breeze-up purchase; finished nicely for second of 13 in the Convivial Maiden at York (7f, good to firm) on debut and got on top by a neck from a Gosden-trained newcomer when 7-4 favourite for maiden at Yarmouth (1m, good to soft); it looks like 1m2f will suit him well and he has a Group 1 Futurity entry.

column4: Emirates Autumn Stakes (Group 3)

column36: Successful on the July course here two months ago; yard has great record in this race
column37: Dubawi colt who justified favouritism with neck success in maiden on the July course here (7f, good to firm) two months ago; runner-up has advertised the form since; yard has an excellent record in this race; respected.

column4: Emirates Autumn Stakes (Group 3)

column36: Ran well in the Tattersalls Stakes; has raced only twice and may do better still
column37: The only runner who already has Group form, having finished third in the Tattersalls Stakes here (7f, good; beaten just over 5l) last time; has raced only twice and may do better still.

column4: Emirates Autumn Stakes (Group 3)
column19: There are unexposed types aplenty. AL ZANATI gets the percentage call ahead of Hankelow and Straight Up.

column36: Ran creditably in Haydock Listed event last time but needs improvement on ratings
column37: Has shown fairly useful form in winning on the July course here and finishing fourth in Haydock Listed contest, both over 1m; however, needs improvement on bare ratings in this field.

column4: Emirates Autumn Stakes (Group 3)

column37: Cost 210,000gns as a foal and 750,000gns as a yearling; beaten only a whisker in Doncaster Listed event when attempting to follow up his York win (both 7f, good); top on the figures and promises to do better still.

column37: Held on only narrowly in maiden at the Doncaster St Leger meeting (1m, soft) but did it under mostly hands-and-heels riding and pulled clear with the runner-up; nice prospect for Ed Dunlop.

column36: Bottom of this pack on ratings but he's two from two and may well improve further
column37: Two from two, namely comfortable wins in Leicester novice event (7f, good to firm) and Curragh sales race (6.3f, yielding); has quickly reached a useful standard and may well show further progress, which is admittedly needed; bottom of this pack on ratings.

column4: Darley Dewhurst Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Zavateri and Gstaad are difficult to split. DISTANT STORM has Dewhurst written all over him, while Oxagon is solid.
column20: 15/8 Distant Storm, 3/1 Gstaad, 7/2 Zavateri, 8/1 Oxagon, 9/1 Italy, 18/1 Alparslan, 20/1 Gewan, 25/1 Saba Desert, 66/1 Pacific Avenue
column36: Impressive in the Tattersalls Stakes over C&D last time; Group 1 colt in the making
column37: 1,900,000euros breeze-up purchase; pulled too hard in the Acomb but that defeat is flanked by Newmarket wins; debut form has worked out well and he was impressive in the Goup 3 Tattersalls Stakes over C&D (good) last time having settled better than at York; looks a Group 1 performer in the making and commands respect.

column4: Darley Dewhurst Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Zavateri and Gstaad are difficult to split. DISTANT STORM has Dewhurst written all over him, while Oxagon is solid.
column20: 15/8 Distant Storm, 3/1 Gstaad, 7/2 Zavateri, 8/1 Oxagon, 9/1 Italy, 18/1 Alparslan, 20/1 Gewan, 25/1 Saba Desert, 66/1 Pacific Avenue
column36: Beaten favourite in the Champagne Stakes, failing to back up his Acomb form
column37: Beat a couple of today's rivals in the Group 3 Acomb at York (7f, good to firm; followed up debut win) but isn't guaranteed to confirm the placings, having failed to back up the form when favourite in the Group 2 Champagne Stakes at Doncaster where he was two places behind Oxagon.

column4: Darley Dewhurst Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Zavateri and Gstaad are difficult to split. DISTANT STORM has Dewhurst written all over him, while Oxagon is solid.
column20: 15/8 Distant Storm, 3/1 Gstaad, 7/2 Zavateri, 8/1 Oxagon, 9/1 Italy, 18/1 Alparslan, 20/1 Gewan, 25/1 Saba Desert, 66/1 Pacific Avenue
column32: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
column36: Coventry winner; good second in the Prix Morny and National Stakes; major contender
column37: Ballydoyle colt who landed the Coventry at Royal Ascot in great style; hasn't quite been able to justify favouritism in the Prix Morny or National Stakes but those good efforts confirm that there's likely a Group 1 prize in him; lost out only narrowly in good tussle with Zavateri in latter at the Curragh (upped to 7f, yielding) latest; major contender.

column4: Darley Dewhurst Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Zavateri and Gstaad are difficult to split. DISTANT STORM has Dewhurst written all over him, while Oxagon is solid.
column20: 15/8 Distant Storm, 3/1 Gstaad, 7/2 Zavateri, 8/1 Oxagon, 9/1 Italy, 18/1 Alparslan, 20/1 Gewan, 25/1 Saba Desert, 66/1 Pacific Avenue

column4: Darley Dewhurst Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Zavateri and Gstaad are difficult to split. DISTANT STORM has Dewhurst written all over him, while Oxagon is solid.

column36: Form stacks up well; good second in the Group 2 Champagne Stakes most recently; solid
column37: Thrice-raced colt whose form stacks up well; about 5l behind Distant Storm on debut but may well get closer to that rival in the rematch, having improved sharply since, most recently second in the Group 2 Champagne Stakes at Doncaster (7f, good) behind the subsequent Lagardere winner; solid.

column4: Darley Dewhurst Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Zavateri and Gstaad are difficult to split. DISTANT STORM has Dewhurst written all over him, while Oxagon is solid.
column20: 15/8 Distant Storm, 3/1 Gstaad, 7/2 Zavateri, 8/1 Oxagon, 9/1 Italy, 18/1 Alparslan, 20/1 Gewan, 25/1 Saba Desert, 66/1 Pacific Avenue
column36: Not disgraced in the Solario and Royal Lodge but needs to find improvement
column37: Form of debut success (on the July course here) has worked out nicely; far from disgraced with fourth-place finishes in the Solario at Sandown and Royal Lodge at Newmarket (1m) since; drop back to 7f may suit but he needs improvement to land this prize.

column4: Darley Dewhurst Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Zavateri and Gstaad are difficult to split. DISTANT STORM has Dewhurst written all over him, while Oxagon is solid.
column20: 15/8 Distant Storm, 3/1 Gstaad, 7/2 Zavateri, 8/1 Oxagon, 9/1 Italy, 18/1 Alparslan, 20/1 Gewan, 25/1 Saba Desert, 66/1 Pacific Avenue
column36: Won the Superlative but flopped badly in the Group 1 National Stakes; headgear applied
column37: Presents a dilemma as he looked a plausible Dewhurst prospect with his Group 2 Superlative win on the July course here (beat Italy) but subsequently flopped badly, finishing last of six, in the Group 1 National Stakes; chance partly depends on how well he responds to first-time headgear.

column4: Darley Dewhurst Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Zavateri and Gstaad are difficult to split. DISTANT STORM has Dewhurst written all over him, while Oxagon is solid.
column20: 15/8 Distant Storm, 3/1 Gstaad, 7/2 Zavateri, 8/1 Oxagon, 9/1 Italy, 18/1 Alparslan, 20/1 Gewan, 25/1 Saba Desert, 66/1 Pacific Avenue
column36: National Stakes winner; progressive, very game, still unbeaten and top on ratings
column37: Star performer for Eve Johnson Houghton this term and his unbeaten record features wins in the July Stakes, Vintage Stakes and Group 1 National Stakes; prevailed narrowly from Gstaad at the Curragh (7f, yielding) most recently, displaying the same battling attribute that served him well at Glorious Goodwood; progressive, very game and top on ratings.

column4: Club Godolphin Cesarewitch Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Having given his most assured 2m performance last time, FIREBLADE (nap) can now hit a new high. Alphonse Le Grande is feared most.

column36: Creditable, keeping-on third in the 2m2f Doncaster Cup on latest outing; needs a bit extra
column37: Fifth (hampered) and sixth (trip looked too sharp) in the last two Ebor Handicaps over 1m6f at York in August; creditable, keeping-on third in the Doncaster Cup on latest outing showed he stays this marathon distance; he needs to take his form to a new level, however, if he's to win this.

column4: Club Godolphin Cesarewitch Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)

column36: No win this year but she's run with credit almost every time; each-way player
column37: No win this year but she's run with credit every time except for in the Chester Cup; serious traffic problems when fifth of 20 off today's mark at Royal Ascot (2m4f, good to firm) on penultimate start; each-way player.

column4: Club Godolphin Cesarewitch Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Having given his most assured 2m performance last time, FIREBLADE (nap) can now hit a new high. Alphonse Le Grande is feared most.
column20: 7/1 Alphonse Le Grande,  Reverend Hubert, 8/1 Dawn Rising,  Bunting,  Beylerbeyi, 9/1 Belgravian, 10/1 Hipop De Loire, 12/1 Winter Fog,  Pole Star,  Manxman,  Divine Comedy, 14/1 Mordor, 16/1 Ndaawi, 22/1 Caprelo, 28/1 The Shunter,  Barnso, 33/1 Fireblade, 40/1 Seddon, 66/1 Bashful Boy, 100/1 Vaguely Royal
column36: Always-prominent fourth at Royal Ascot (1m6f, good to firm); respectable yard debut latest
column37: Markedly progressive overall when trained by Natalia Lupini in Northern Ireland, rounding it off with an always-prominent fourth of 16 at Royal Ascot (1m6f, good to firm); changed hands before a respectable show at Goodwood ten weeks ago; while going beyond 1m6f for the first time looks worth a go, it's hard to know whether it will help sufficiently to win this top handicap.

column4: Club Godolphin Cesarewitch Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Having given his most assured 2m performance last time, FIREBLADE (nap) can now hit a new high. Alphonse Le Grande is feared most.
column20: 7/1 Alphonse Le Grande,  Reverend Hubert, 8/1 Dawn Rising,  Bunting,  Beylerbeyi, 9/1 Belgravian, 10/1 Hipop De Loire, 12/1 Winter Fog,  Pole Star,  Manxman,  Divine Comedy, 14/1 Mordor, 16/1 Ndaawi, 22/1 Caprelo, 28/1 The Shunter,  Barnso, 33/1 Fireblade, 40/1 Seddon, 66/1 Bashful Boy, 100/1 Vaguely Royal
column36: 7lb lower than when about 4l sixth in this race last year, which gives him a shot
column37: Won 2m5f Queen Alexandra at Royal Ascot in 2023 and a 2m Group 3 at the Curragh last November; also third, fifth and fifth in last three editions of the 2m1f Irish Cesarewitch in September (sole run in cheekpieces last time) and while none of his 2025 form looks good enough to win this, he's 7lb lower than when about 4l sixth in this contest last year, which gives him a shot.

column4: Club Godolphin Cesarewitch Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Having given his most assured 2m performance last time, FIREBLADE (nap) can now hit a new high. Alphonse Le Grande is feared most.
column20: 7/1 Alphonse Le Grande,  Reverend Hubert, 8/1 Dawn Rising,  Bunting,  Beylerbeyi, 9/1 Belgravian, 10/1 Hipop De Loire, 12/1 Winter Fog,  Pole Star,  Manxman,  Divine Comedy, 14/1 Mordor, 16/1 Ndaawi, 22/1 Caprelo, 28/1 The Shunter,  Barnso, 33/1 Fireblade, 40/1 Seddon, 66/1 Bashful Boy, 100/1 Vaguely Royal
column36: Won this in 2023 but well beaten last year; ground softer than good would be preferred
column37: Veteran whose big-race win on the Flat came in this contest on soft ground in 2023 off 3lb lower than today; missed most of last year (well beaten in this on return, ran creditably next time) and he's had just one race this season, when not discredited (ninth of 20) at Galway in July; ground softer than good would be preferred.

column4: Club Godolphin Cesarewitch Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Having given his most assured 2m performance last time, FIREBLADE (nap) can now hit a new high. Alphonse Le Grande is feared most.

column36: Never-nearer fifth of 15 in valuable handicap at Leopardstown (1m5f) gave renewed hope
column37: Started his career with maiden wins on the Flat in France and over hurdles in Ireland; he's seemingly not lived up to expectations in the latter sphere and has returned to Flat for last two outings, never-nearer fifth of 17 in valuable handicap at Leopardstown (1m5f) on latest; that gave renewed hope, for trainer and owner who have both made their marks in this race.

column4: Club Godolphin Cesarewitch Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Having given his most assured 2m performance last time, FIREBLADE (nap) can now hit a new high. Alphonse Le Grande is feared most.

column32: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
column36: Pipped in this last year and he looks set for another big run judged on peak 2025 efforts
column37: Progressive in 2023 and 2024, pipped by Alphonse Le Grande on soft ground in this race last season, and peak performances this term have been better still; that includes latest start, when finishing well off this mark at Goodwood; he'd have a lot more to prove on good to firm ground than good or softer; otherwise looks set for a big run.

column4: Club Godolphin Cesarewitch Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Having given his most assured 2m performance last time, FIREBLADE (nap) can now hit a new high. Alphonse Le Grande is feared most.

column36: Won this last year; last two runs suggest he could still have another big handicap in him
column37: Three big-race wins in Britain last year included the Chester Plate (2m2f, good to firm) and this race (soft; 6lb higher today); while nothing like that impact this term, trying to come from the back at Royal Ascot was a nightmare and it wasn't much better at York's Ebor meeting, beaten 3l in both; they suggested he could still have another big handicap win in him.

column4: Club Godolphin Cesarewitch Handicap (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)

column36: Unraced beyond an extended 1m6f but no doubt he's well handicapped and thriving

column37: 3yo whose five handicaps have all been over about 1m6f, with two wins (good/soft) and respectable efforts in valuable races on last two outings; 2m+ could suit, so he's not entirely dismissed.

column37: Five-race maiden whose best effort was when beaten a head by a 66-1 shot in a Salisbury seller (7f, heavy) last month; third of seven on his nursery debut at Ripon (1m, good) 15 days later; needs more.

column37: Close third of five on nursery debut at Thirsk (1m, good) last month and again ran well when third of nine at Haydock (7f, good to soft) a fortnight ago, when shaping as though this return to 1m may be a plus; chance.

column20: 4/1 Rowdy Yeats, 9/2 Bishopton, 5/1 Tina's Indian, 13/2 Genuine Article, 8/1 I Am Superman, 10/1 Serengeti,  Chicago Fireball,  Midnight Strike, 14/1 On A Session, 20/1 Facethepuckout,  San Aer, 25/1 Musical Act, 66/1 Brewing
column36: Knows how to win and came from too far back when fifth at Listowel last time
column37: Career win number seven when beating 14 rivals at Galway (7f, soft) and not a bad last run at Listowel when upside Midnight Strike, given that he came from well off the speed.

column4: Naas Racecourse Handicap
column19: A chance is taken with ON A SESSION. He was held up at Listowel last time on a day it was hard to come from off the pace.
column20: 4/1 Rowdy Yeats, 9/2 Bishopton, 5/1 Tina's Indian, 13/2 Genuine Article, 8/1 I Am Superman, 10/1 Serengeti,  Chicago Fireball,  Midnight Strike, 14/1 On A Session, 20/1 Facethepuckout,  San Aer, 25/1 Musical Act, 66/1 Brewing
column36: Won this two years ago off this very mark and this year hasn't been a washout by any means
column37: Won this two years ago off this very mark and this year hasn't been a washout by any means, securing a seventh career win in June; last two runs not his best but could bounce back.

column37: Has won four times on the Flat but had plenty of racing in both disciplines; the odd decent run this year for previous yard but others appeal more.
